description: Halaesa is located on the north coast of Sicily between between Kalakta and Kephaloidion. The city was founded in 403 B.C. by Archonides of Herbita. The city sided with Rome during the First Punic War and was made "libera et immunis". By the Augustan period it had become a municipium.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: near Castel di Tusa

names.details: The ancient place of Halaesa is listed under "Tusa" in the BTCGI. The association is also found in Manni 1981 and the Barrington Atlas.
